intro: Clinanthus fabianae, commonly known as the Fabian's flaxflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes numerous species of bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Clinanthus fabianae is considered a vulnerable species.
